description: Michele Hammer  added  8 new photos  —  feeling blessed with  Jessica Sims  and  7 others  in  Prescott, Arizona . This last weekend our family celebrated the life of our dearest Mom, who passed away at 91 years young. Her vibrant and giving life was the basis for how all of us so close to her faced life's challenges.   Now today, a week later, as her puppy is  learning a whole new life in Southern California courtesy of Mom's granddaughter Beth, and all of us have returned home from Medford, I wanted to share with you a poem my Mom wrote for me on the occasion of my 21st birthday.   These words have lived with me and guided my actions and behaviors for over four decades, and I can think of a no more lasting tribute to my Mom's legacy then what she shared with me those many years ago.                          To Michele  Oh golden haired babe of my youth  count the candles I see- 21?  How can time go by so quickly?  Seems like yesterday there was just one.  Sweet little girl with the solemn blue eyes   who clung to the hem of my dress,   I look at you now so tall so mature,   so full of fun and liveliness.  I've tried to teach you the values   that will bring you inner wealth,   the basic creed is simple   trust others as you would yourself.  I realize now this can't work for all   as many can't fill the bill,   for the secret is first liking yourself   and I know you always will.  You'll love your children as we've loved you and your teach them right from wrong, remember to always hold them and laugh   and at night saying them your lullaby song.  I've written this poem for you my dear  knowing how sentimental you can be,   when things go wrong read it over again   for truth has no facsimile.  Oh golden haired babe of my youth   Someday you know we must part,   but as once I held you in my arms   through all time I'll hold you in my heart.                                 4-27-76

description: Michele Hammer  was  feeling loved with  Jessica Sims  and  6 others  at  Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport . As I sit at the Phoenix airport waiting for my flight to Medford Oregon,  I am reflecting on how blessed I am to receive such wonderful messages, texts, phone calls and emails on the loss of my Mom. She would've been 92 September 5th   This is going to be extremely hard week for myself and my family as we say goodbye to a beautiful woman who impacted many lives, two and four-legged.   Alzheimer's is a cruel disease which robbed my Mom of her sharp mind and I feel at peace that she is no longer in pain and has joined my Dad. 🙏  My Moms 8th Great grandchild , Sadie Jean Sims was born 10 days before she passed and Mom was able to see pictures of this beautiful little girl and I was told, by the caregivers,  that seeing her always made her smile 💕  I am forever grateful for my family support.  I don't think I could've gotten through the last few days without the love and support of Megan McNamee, Greg McNamee, Jessica Sims, Hunter Sims, my beautiful granddaughters , grand puppies  🐶  and of course my rock, my amazing husband Mike.  My mom also was supported in Medford by amazing  and caring people   I was able to honor her wishes and keep her at home until she passed. Thank you does not even begin to describe how much I appreciate what  Donna Oconnor ,  Valisatie Burt ,  Matthew Van Sickle  and her caregivers continually did for her and myself over the years.   The last conversation I had with her hours before she passed was that I loved her which I said every time I talked to her and she said that she loved me.   I take every day as a gift and I try to make sure my Village  knows how much they mean to me ❤️ Michele Michele Hammer

description: Megan McNamee  added  2 new photos  — with  Jessica Sims  and  2 others . We are so sad to say goodbye to  Michele Hammer  and Steve Rodermund's mom (and my last living grandparent) Patricia Jean Rodermund. Grandma Patsy would have turned 92 this September and was a strong-willed yet amazingly compassionate woman who left 2 children, 5 grandchildren, and 8 great-grandchildren here on earth. Baby Sadie was born just in time for Grandma to know that all of her grandchildren were parents  <3    My mom has spent the last decade going to see her many times a year in Medford, Oregon and helping to take care of her from afar. We are all devastated by her passing but know that she's finally at peace.   She was an expert canner and pickle maker (and a master cook) - I hope to live out her legacy of sharing good food, caring for the voiceless, and being a strong, sassy chick until the end.  Grandma passed away at home with her dog by her side - as she hoped it would happen when the time came - and now we smile at her memory, knowing that she's finally with Grandpa.   We love you Grandma Pat! Michele Hammer Michele Hammer Michele Hammer Megan McNamee Jessica Sims Megan
